newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAfrican group confirms buys Malbak's Defy.
newsitem.headline: SAfrican group confirms buys Malbak's Defy.

text.p: A South African consortium of Firstcorp Capital and Defy management confirmed on Wednesday it had bought Malbak-controlled white goods manufacturer Defy.

The firm gave no indication of price but Business Day newspaper reported earlier that the price-tag was 179 million rand, pipping Sweden's Electrolux, which placed a bid of between 200 and 300 million rand.
Defy chief executive officer Ross Heron said management's knowledge of the business could have contributed to the succesful joint bid.
Defy has an annual turnover exceeding 700 million rand and a workforce of 2,400. It holds about 32 percent of South Africa's market share.
"We are excited about market growth prospects in view of the intensive electrification programme and housing development within the country," Heron said.
The disposals by Malbak of its unlisted subsidiaries form part of the group's decision to unbundle its assets in a bid to unlock the value of its underlying investments.
